quoteTime: about twelve o’clock in the morn
quoteLast: ing of the next day Mr. Petre was walking slowly along the Embankment, looking at the tide that rushed past and communing with his own soul. It was a breezy, sunny, spring day.

author: Belloc, Hilaire, 1870-1953; Chesterton, G. K. (Gilbert Keith), 1874-1936 [Illustrator]

quoteFirst: This rapid transition from wantonness to devotion, from paganism to Christianity, has something startling and unnatural about it. At
quoteLast: the senses are all aglow; midnight sounds, and in a minute they are supposed to be brought low, and the heart to be full of humble repentance; it is an absurdity, an impossibility.
title: The Memoirs of Jacques Casanova de Seingalt, 1725-1798. Volume 26: Spain
author: Casanova, Giacomo, 1725-1798; Machen, Arthur, 1863-1947 [Translator]
